data.title: Thomas Grosvenor MP (1655-1700)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Thomas Grosvenor MP born 1655 Eaton, Cheshire, England died 1700 Eaton, Cheshire, England including ancestors + descendants + 2 photos + 1 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 31 Dec 2021 | Created 9 Dec 2011

This page has been accessed 1,649 times.

Contents

1 Biography

1.1 Marriage

1.2 Death

2 Sources

Biography

Sir Thomas Grosvenor was a member of the aristocracy in British Isles.

Thomas Grosvenor MP was born in Eaton, Cheshire, England.

Thomas Grosvenor was born on 20 Nov 1655 at Eaton, Cheshire, England.

He was the son of Roger Grosvenor and Christian Myddelton of Chirk Castle, Denbighshire, Wales.

SIBLINGS:

Anne Grosvenor

Robert Grosvenor

John Grosvenor

Roger Grosvenor

Thomas was four years old when his father, Roger Grosvenor was killed in a duel with his cousin, Hugh Roberts, on 22 August 1661. Roger had been the son and heir of Sir Richard Grosvenor, 2nd Baronet of Eaton Hall, and therefore, this Profile's Thomas Grosvenor succeeded to the baronetcy upon the death of his Grandfather on 31 January 1665 - he was eight years old at that time. [1]

Marriage

Sir Thomas Grosvenor, 3rd Baronet married Mary Davies (1664–1729) on 8 Oct 1677 in St Margaret, Westminster, Middlesex, England. She was the daughter of Alexander Davies, scrivener, of Ebury, Middlesex, England. [2]

CHILDREN:

Richard Grosvenor MP (1689–1732) 4th Baronet

Thomas Grosvenor MP (1693-1732 ) 5th Baronet died less than one year after succeeding to the baronetcy.

Robert Grosvenor MP (1695–1755) 6th Baronet

Anne Grosvenor Leveson Gower (1700–1731)

Sophia Grosvenor

Death

Sir Thomas Grosvenor, 3rd Baronet of Eaton Hall, MP passed away on 2 Jul 1700 at Eaton, Cheshire, England. He was buried in the St Mary the Virgin Churchyard, Eccleston, Cheshire, England. [3]

Probate was granted in 1700. [4]

Sources
